Title: Announcing Azure DevOps Server General Availability
Author: Gloridel Morales
EnhancedContent:
We’re thrilled to announce that Azure DevOps Server is now generally available (GA)! This release marks the transition from the [Release Candidate](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/announcing-the-new-azure-devops-server-rc-release/) (RC) phase to full production readiness, delivering enterprise-grade DevOps capabilities for organizations that prefer self-hosted solutions.

You can upgrade directly from Azure DevOps Server RC or any supported version of Team Foundation Server (TFS 2015 and newer). Head over to the [release notes](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/devops/server/release-notes/azuredevopsserver?view=azure-devops-server) for a complete breakdown of changes included with this release.

> >
> **Note:** Team Foundation Server 2015 reached the end of Extended Support on October 14, 2025. We strongly recommend upgrading to Azure DevOps Server to maintain security and compliance.
> >

Here are some key links:

- [Azure DevOps Server ISO](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=2330654)
- [Azure DevOps Server Web Install](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=2330549)
- [Release Notes](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/devops/server/release-notes/azuredevopsserver?view=azure-devops-server)
- [Download Azure DevOps Server](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/devops/server/download/azuredevopsserver?view=azure-devops#download-the-latest-release)
- [Azure DevOps Server requirements and compatibility](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/devops/server/requirements?view=azure-devops-2022&viewFallbackFrom=azure-devops&branch=releasenotes%2FAzureDevOpsServer2020)
- [Installation documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/devops/server/install/get-started?view=azure-devops&branch=releasenotes%2FAzureDevOpsServer2020)

We’d love for you to install this release and provide any feedback at [Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/AzureDevOpsServerTFS).
